data.title: Gainesville Rabbit Rescue
data.text:
Join us at the Oviedo Sports Complex, located at 1251 E. Broadway Street, for a morning of fun for the whole family! Watch a helicopter take flight to drop hundreds of marshmallows. Once the marshmallows have dropped, children can race to collect as many as possible and redeem them for candy. Then, join vendors and entertainment for a morning of fun.

Cost

Tickets Sales begin March 19, 2018

$3.00 before Saturday, March 31

$5.00 day of event (CASH ONLY)

Pre-sale tickets will be available at Riverside Park, 1600 Lockwood Boulevard, and the Gymnasium and Aquatic Facility, 148 Oviedo Boulevard.

Only children entering the field require wristbands. Parents/Guardians/Grandparents will not be allowed on field. However, if child is under 2 years of age, then 1 parent per child is allowed to escort child onto field without purchasing a wristband.

Arrive early for parking (carpool too). The first drop starts promptly at 10am!

Activities for kids ages 0 – 10. Marshmallows exchanged for goodie bags. Surprise grand prizes.

Vendor spots are available, as well as great sponsorship opportunities. For more information about this event call 407-971-5590.

For more information about vendor and sponsorship opportunities, call Terri Martini Ash at 407-971-5588.

“The Greatest Show in Gainesville” features the World Famous Flying Wallendas and other circus and comedy stars performing live on 5 stages at the historic Thomas Center in downtown Gainesville.

Hilarity, hijinks, and feats of derring-do will thrill and amaze the entire family at this free event. The legendary Flying Wallendas star with their famous daredevil high-wire act, along with a revolving cast of clowns, jugglers, magicians, sword swallowers, stiltwalkers, a one-man band, and our fabulous food court! Plus pony rides, ice cream, roving entertainers, and so much more! Come be a part of the fun!

Visit their FB Event page for more info: → https://www.facebook.com/jestfestgainesville/

Location:

Cedar Lakes Woods and Gardens

4990 NE 180th Ave Williston, Florida 32696

Activities:

Speaker Schedule:

12:00 p.m. Korin Sutton “3x Pro Bodybuilder”

“Where’s The Protein Being Vegan?”

1:00 p.m. Jenna Bardroff, Kevin Layton, Brian Brown

“A Beautiful You Can Create A Beautiful World”

Live Music:

11:00 a.m. Brian Brown

Brian Brown the Younger is a musician from Tampa playing soulful instrumental guitar with influences from trip hop, post rock, psychedelic rock, and Americana. His fans have described him as being a “pretty alright dude” and having a “mega chill vibe, man”.

12:00 p.m. Jennifer Van Bergen

1:00 p.m. The Fickle Souls

Straight from the mountains of North Carolina, the now Tampa based acoustic folk/indie duo, The Fickle Souls are taking music back to its roots, keeping it simple, and keeping it pure. The band was founded in late 2012 when singer/songwriter Cal Olivier decided to move in a new direction, feeling that folk music would allow him to express a truer range of emotion and life experience.

The duo now consists of Cal Olivier on the Guitar and Kick Drum and Hannah Irene on the Harmonium.

Cal Olivier & the Fickle Souls have collectively shared the stage, and studio with the likes of; Bela Fleck & the Flecktones, Tommy Tutone, Greg Hawks (The Cars), Rehab, Steel Pulse, Keller Williams, John Paul White (The Civil Wars), along with many more.

Yoga Schedule:

11:00 a.m. Yoga for Athletes by Zen Yoga

1:30 p.m. Island Yoga

Film Schedule:

2:00 p.m. What The Health

Kids Activities:

– Make eco friendly “edible” paint!

– Make plantable upcycled paper

– Create natural bird feeders!

– Kids eco-friendly obstacle course

– Face painting

Enjoy FREE ACCESS TO THE SANTA FE COLLEGE TEACHING ZOO compliments of Bosshardt realty, as well as ENTER PRIZE DRAWINGS, partake in TONS OF FUN ACTIVITIES AND GAMES in the PBS Kids Zone sponsored by Newberry Animal Hospital, ADOPT YOUR NEW FAMILY PET from one of the many pet adoption organizations, and enjoy PET AND ANIMAL DEMONSTRATIONS every 20 minutes in the demonstration zone presented by Daytime Dog and Friends! Entry to this event is free-of-charge and no RSVP is required; come spend your day with WUFT, and get ready to stop, paws and learn!

*Due to safety and sanitation reasons, please do not bring your pet to the event. There will be plenty of treats and tricks to bring back to your pet after the event is over!

Location: Santa Fe Teaching Zoo / 3000 NW 83rd St Gainesville, Florida 32606

Time: Saturday, December 9 at 10 AM – 2 PM

We have a day for giving thanks. We have two for getting deals. Now, we have #GivingTuesday, a global day dedicated to giving back. On Tuesday, November 28, 2017, charities, families, businesses, community centers, and students around the world will come together for one common purpose: to celebrate generosity and to give.

It’s a simple idea. Just find a way for your family, your community, your company or your organization to come together to give something more. Then tell everyone you can about how you are giving. Join us and be a part of a global celebration of a new tradition of generosity.

To help the bunnies, visit here: https://www.facebook.com/donate/241814876353679/10214335016230962/
